title: Multimodal CoT Reasoning

definitions.Reasoning: Process of forming a judgment or decision
definitions.Accuracy: Correctness of a measurement or calculation

summary: The slide discusses the impact of rationales on answer prediction in multimodal CoT reasoning. It provides an example where the No-CoT method predicts the answer directly, while the Reasoning method conditions the answer inference to the rationale. The accuracy of the No-CoT method is 81.63%, and the Reasoning method is 69.32%, showing a significant drop in accuracy when using the latter.
